name: Emma Taylor
feedback: I have been waiting. I've been waiting all day. Waiting for Gus to send one of his men to kill me. And it's you. Who do you know, who's okay with using children, Jesse? Who do you know… who's allowed children to be murdered… hmm? Gus! He has, he has been ten steps ahead of me at every turn.

name: Adrian Anderson
feedback: The one thing that he needed to finally get rid of me is your consent and boy he's got that now. He's got it. And not only does he have that, but he manipulated you into pulling the trigger for him. Come on! Don't you see? You are the last piece of the puzzle. You are everything that he's wanted.

name: Cameron Mitchell
feedback: There are no mistakes. You can fix anything that happens. Just let your mind wander and enjoy. This should make you happy. You can do anything your heart can imagine. Get away from those little Christmas tree things we used to make in school. Maybe there was an old trapper that lived out here.

name: Adrian Burgess
feedback: I am in the process of developing a few new websites for some clients. I have found that they are not always, um, shall we say, 'Timely' when it comes to supply me with the actual copy/content for the site. As you can imagine, I cannot just want around for them to give me the words that go on the page!

name: Felicity Payne
feedback: Well, I was in a playful mood and did not want the typical, boring text. So I turned to my friend Google and ask for some alternatives. It seems that Mashable has already combined a list of 56 alternatives to the boring Latin looking text! just want around for them to give me the words that go on the page!

name: Sonia Hart
feedback: Nothing. It’s a classic, after all. But we all get bored from seeing the same thing over and over again. Besides, surprising the rest of your design team with something else other than Lorem Ipsum might rip quite a few laughs and smiles – especially some of the alternatives on this list.
